caption:
This photograph captures two individuals engaged in a thrilling water activity. They are in a small, speeding boat that's cutting through the water, generating sprays of water around it. The boat, possibly a small motorboat, has a sleek design and seems to be made of a light-colored material. 

The two individuals on the boat appear lively and are interacting with the camera. They are both shirtless, suggesting warm weather, and are wearing life vests, indicating safety precautions for the activity. One person is driving the boat, gripping the steering mechanism attentively while looking straightforward, likely focusing on navigating. The other person is seated beside the driver, waving cheerfully at the camera, reflecting a joyous and adventurous mood.

The setting is aquatic, most likely a lake or a wide river, given the calm water. The lighting in the photograph is natural, with strong sunlight enhancing the energetic splash of the water droplets. This recreation scene captures a moment of joy and adventure, effectively conveying the excitement of water sports.
title: A "drag boat," one of a small number of such craft on the lake.  These high powered speedboats make up in noise what they lack in size.  Many--like the one shown here--have water-cooled exhausts
placename: Ozarks, Lake of the, State Park (Mo.)
location: Ozarks, Lake of the, State Park, Missouri
